data.title: Broken Game.Exit() for Android
data.body:
I probably broke `Game.Exit()` for the Android platform in #5317.
That should be fixed before the 3.6 release. I'm opening this so it's not forgotten.

data.title: OpenGL ES support ?
data.body: Will the new SDL2 monogame platform support OpenglES ?

data.title: [WP8] fix Texture2D.FromStream()
data.body:
The current implementation uses `Threading.BlockOnUIThread()` which has
a timeout of 750ms (`kMaxWaitForUIThread`).
This isn't enough for loading streams (either from the net or from the
slow  storage). The result is that the execution continues before the
bitmap is loaded and a Null exception is thrown from accessing `bitmap`.

data.title: [WP8] fix resume for DrawingSurfaceBackgroundGrid
data.body:
When DrawingSurfaceBackgroundGrid is used we don't own the _d3device/_d3dContext, 
it's provided by IDrawingSurfaceBackgroundContentProviderNative.

Trying to dispose the previous device/context thows a System.NullReferenceException and resume result to a black screen/freeze.

data.title: [WP8] Allow debuging on devices or machines that don't have the debug runtime installed.
Rollback dependencies to SDL 2.0.5 after #5194
data.body:
#5194 reverted the latest Dependencies submodule head to a previous commit.

This PR set the dependencies back to the latest SDL 2.0.5 requirements.

data.title: Repair and restore the Windows 8 templates
data.body:
* Fix Windows 8 Templates to target 8.1 natively
* Fix UWP Universal template to correct version
* Enable Windows8 templates for VS2015

data.title: Remove WindowsPhone
data.body:
Removed WindowsPhone and WindowsPhone81 from the framework
Also removed the old Windows 8 Universal project as it just left it with "Windows8"

data.title: WiiU Hooks
data.body: Adding the hooks for the private WiiU repo.

data.title: Misc Pipeline Fix
data.body:
Two simple pipeline fixes/improvements.

Fixed case in `FontDescriptionProcessor` where we were consuming fatal exceptions instead of letting them be reported to the user as errors.

Protect against crashes when `message` or `messageArgs` is null in `ConsoleLogger.LogWarning()`.

data.title: Drop Platform "WindowsPhone"?
data.body:
Like Ouya, Windows Phone 7 is probably about as dead as it's going to get.
We can't publish WP7 titles anymore and for those still updating WP7 titles, they can use the existing release as it's highly unlikely it's going to be updated.

data.title: Make Game.Exit set a flag to exit at the end of the tick.
data.body:
As discussed in #5127 `Game.Exit` should not immediately dispose of the game window, but should set a flag and handle actual exiting and disposal at the end of the tick.
fixes #5127

I think this doesn't work for Android since it uses a [custom run loop](https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/7c3d6870a38f8a5e479e64d935d692f2610e1cda/MonoGame.Framework/Android/AndroidGamePlatform.cs#L105). @dellis1972 How should this be handled? 
Are there any other platforms that have their own run loop?

data.title: Marshal size of refactor
data.body:
PR to address #5280

All elements supporting Generics (<T>) aligned to new ReflectionHelpers.SizeOf<T> function.
SizeOf<T> tested against platforms for support. Linux / Windows falls back to old SizeOf(Type) method

IndexBuffer however has no generics, so a fall back method in ReflectionHelpers added to enable caching of Marshal.SizeOf implemented using a dictionary.

Both IndexBuffer and VertexBuffer should really support generics fully but this would be a breaking change.

data.title: Regression in 2MGFX
data.body:
I think I have found a bug in 2MGFX.

I have a FXAA shader that compiles fine in the 3.5 version of 2MGFX but fails to compile with some strange errors in the latest version from the development branch.

I have attached the shader with a bat file that processes it both successfully with the old version and shows the new failure.

I have about 20 other effects being compiled with the latest 2MGFX correctly. The issue only effects this shader.

[Monogame 2MGFX Fail.zip](https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/files/605595/Monogame.2MGFX.Fail.zip)

data.title: Add function of VertexContent does not grow vertex channels automatically
data.body:
From MSDN:
[https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.graphics.vertexcontent.add(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.graphics.vertexcontent.add(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx)
> VertexContent.Add Method
> Appends a new vertex index to the end of the PositionIndices collection.
> Other vertex channels will automatically be extended and the new indices populated with default values.

MonoGame cannot automatically extend vertex channels.
[https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Graphics/VertexContent.cs](https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Graphics/VertexContent.cs)

Is there any other way to add element to existed VertexChannel?

data.title: PipelineTool 'building' status display
data.body:
The standard, following visual studios behavior, would be to have a status bar that indicates 'building' or 'build done' or 'build failed' in some fairly obvious way that doesn't require a mouse-over.

Another nice addition would be to flash the minimized pipelinetool app icon in the taskbar if it is not currently focused when the a build finishes.

data.title: Implement GraphicsAdapter.IsProfileSupported()
Certain Draw overload misplaces Rectangles and ignores scale
data.body:
When using the overload
`Draw(Texture2D texture, Vector2? position = null, Rectangle? destinationRectangle = null, Rectangle? sourceRectangle = null, Vector2? origin = null, float rotation = 0.0f, Vector2? scale = null, Color? color = null, SpriteEffects effects = SpriteEffects.None, float layerDepth = 0.0f)`

the scale is ignored, but only if you give a destinationRectangle (not ignored when using the Vector2 position)
I get that you are supposed to supply either Vector2 + scale OR the Rectangle, but the whole overload is really misleading imo.

Edit: just found another bug with the same overload:
This line works as expected: (not the buggy overload)
`_spriteBatch.Draw(testTex, rect, Color.White);`
while this one draws the rectangle on a completely different place: (buggy overload, should do nearly the same)
`_spriteBatch.Draw(testTex, destinationRectangle: rect, color: Color.White, origin: new Vector2(rect.Width / 2f, rect.Height / 2f));`

data.title: [DesktopGL] Fix debugging from Windows
data.body:
Documentation states that the hint name is `SDL_HINT_WINDOWS_DISABLE_THREAD_NAMING`, but looking at the source code it seems that the hint is `SDL_WINDOWS_DISABLE_THREAD_NAMING` (source code const is getting assigned a different value from it's name). 

In the end I had the time to test this.

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Fix PropertyGrid not rendering on 125% scaling
data.body: Fixes #5285

data.title: Unloading video content leaks memory
Add support for Visual Studio 2017 templates
data.body:
Visual studio 2017 RC has been release ( https://www.visualstudio.com/vs/visual-studio-2017-rc/ ), and the current Monogame installer (3..6 dev) does not support installing the templates into the new version.

Loading an existing project into VS2017 does seem to work. Even existing Xamarin / mobile projects appear to be working. It's just the Monogame templates are missing for adding / creating new projects.

FYI, it appears as though the VS2017 installer comes with the options to install Unity out of the box. Would be pretty awesome to have Monogame as an option when installing VS2017.

data.title: Add documentation for GraphicsDevice.Draw* methods
data.body:
I included remarks that should clarify behavior when a vertexOffset is passed following the discussion in #5294. 

fixes #5294.

data.title: Forcing Lowercase Filepaths on Content Builds
data.body:
MonoGame has to run on case sensitive file systems.  Often this leads to the game breaking on these platforms... sometimes several hours into gameplay... because the case of a content file on disk is different from the string passed to `ContentManager.Load<>()`.  

This is a dangerous behavior and something we should try to correct.

What I propose is adding an optional feature to MGCB to always write lowercase file names when building content to the output folder.  This includes when copying content files to the output.  This must be paired with an option on the `ContentManager` to force lowercase names on file operations.

We could combine this with a warning at content build time when we detect content paths with mixed case during a build.

We already do this sort of fix up with forwardslash vs backslash.  This is just another improvement to the system.

data.title: Use up to 8 render targets.
data.body:
Feature level 10.0 can have up to 8 render targets.
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476876(v=vs.85).aspx

fix http://community.monogame.net/t/error-when-setrendertargets-more-than-4-rtbinding/8408

data.title: Content Pipeline Tools does not build content when started from VS
data.body:
I am getting this strange behavior of Content Pipeline Tool in two cases:
- When tool started by clicking on .mcgb file in VS Solution Explorer
- When tool started by clicking on .mcgb file in Explorer

If Content Pipeline Tools started by clicking on Pipeline.exe evertything is ok.

I suppose that issue is connected with current directory and tool is not able to find required executables.

data.title: Add Tizen Platform
data.body:
Samsung has now officially partnered with Microsoft to provide .NET to Tizen devices.  There is a preview SDK up now:

 https://developer.tizen.org/development/preview

We need to implement a Tizen backend for MonoGame.

data.title: System.BadImageFormatException on program startup

I am getting this runtime error (pasted below) every time I try to run my project. It has only happened since a couple of hours ago, and I can't think of anything significant that I changed that could have caused the problem. Somehow it suddenly stopped working. The last thing I did was toying around with the `ObservableCollection<T>` class and adding the System assembly for it to my project. I already tried removing all of that again but it doesn't seem to be the cause of the problem.

I am using Fedora 24 with Mono 4.6.2 and the latest MonoGame dev build from the downloads section.

data.title: [UWP] Mouse input blocks/delays keyboard input
data.body:
InputEvents.cs is where the keyboard/mouse events are attached to allow MonoGame to collect input.

If the mouse is moving/clicking then keyboard input is delayed until it stops. This includes key released states, so it effects first person game very badly.

Attaching to the CoreWindow's keyboard and mouse events shows this.
Attached to the CoreIndependentInputSource for the Mouse, with the keyboard coming from the CoreWindow (standard practice) also causes this.

This did not occur in Windows 8/8.1 and only occurs in Windows 10.
